A Big Temple in Central Ubud But Not Very Special. It is one of biggest temple in central Ubud and probably, very near to your hotel. You must definitely see its lotus pond when you walk around! Plus, it is free to visit. You can have some drinks in cafe near temple and enjoy the atmosphere! However, there are definitely bigger and better temples around Ubud that you must visit with special tours.
Beautiful lotus pond. Not a big area but the lotus here are beautiful (when they bloom of course). There are starbuck too, so you can enjoy your drink while looking at the beautiful lotus pond.

The best in Ubud, but nothing special. Placed in central ubud, You have to see this place, it one of the best in Ubud themself. But it is rather small. Usually crowded. There are lots of quiter temples in Bali. But If You want to see this place, go in night, maybe there will be some Balinese dance perfomance. In that case this is beautiful

Great place to visit while in Ubud. Lovely Temple well worth a visit better if you have a local that can explain the history, very easy to get too, watch out for the monkeys keep your valuables hidden
just what I had pictured .... just what I had pictured ... and heaps more. So many photo opportunities and great people watching too.

Temple + Starbucks. When I saw this place on the map I thought it must be wrong - seemingly on top of a Starbucks.There is a starbucks at the entrance to the outer courtyard with the lotus flowers, but it's quite inconspicuous. It's does boggle the mind a little, coming around the world to visit a temple and having to walk by a starbucks to get in.Anyway, well worth the visit. You should don a sarong before entering (some available at the entrance). This is my first time seeing lotus flowers up close, thought they were very impressive and unusual.

Nicest temple in ubud. It's very, with a quite suggestive entrance. You can have access to the inside only wearing a sarong, but it's definitely worth to observe and enjoy Balinese architecture and culture!free entrance.

if you are into sculptures, this is the place with entrance fee. Hi, went to this temple, and to Ubud Palace. Paid some entrance fee, overall place is worth a visit. For more entrance fee and souvenirs reviews, http://snapraw.com/album/7

nice temple with beautiful lotos lake. The temple was empty in the late morning, we had a nice and peaceful visit. Not big but very nice.
The lotos pond in front of the temple is beautiful, offering scenery for great pictures.
Beautiful Heritage!. Very beautiful historic but not very well kept and presented like many other touristy places in ubud.

Randomly stumbled upon this beautiful temple. The most beautiful part of this temple is the lotus garden in the front. I always associate lotus with mystical stories for some reason, so it gave me that mystical feel.
It is only a few steps away from the Ubud Palace.
Worth a visit. Has a Starbucks.

Beautiful Lotus Flowers . Saraswati Temple is a quaint little retreat just off the main road of Ubud by the Royal Palace. The temple is fronted by a lake filled with hundreds of Lotus Flowers and split by a path down the centre. The temple is fairly small but with a visit.

Charm, harmony and peace / Bűbáj, harmónia és béke. After rain at five pm especially beautiful (water drops on the leaves and lotus flowers). Situated between Lotus Cafe and Starbucks :-( in the center of Ubud

Small but Beautiful.. Don't really expect to go really inside if the temple, like mostly all the temples in Bali you can't really go in there.But at the entrance there's a beautiful and lovely pond full of lotus.The architecture the temple (well the outside) is colourful and very photogenic.Best of all, no entrance fee, no "massaaggee ??" "Takkksssiii ??" for ten minutes.Don't miss the entrance, there's the "Lotus Café" in the front.
Located in Center. easy accessible to temple, but the noise is much, also the crowd. I would suggest other temples like puri tirtha(Holy water) instead of this temple.

Morning Peaceful Walk. Don't expect something big or very adorned. Sarawasti Temple is good for some morning, midday shots (even for weddings). Small, but totally tuned with Ubud's environment. Not far from Ubud Market, so if you have to be stalked by sellers, this is the place to relieve yourself.

Rare display of pink lotuses. Beautiful place. Go either close to the morning or close to evening to see the open lotuses. It's free during the day but closes at 6pm for a paid dance. I would suggest spending 5-6pm there or earlier in the morning. I've never seen a whole pool of lotus flowers like this.

Lotus And temple. I come with friends,i see the arcitectur is verry good,balinese arcitectur with lotus garden,if you come at evening we look like at romantic area,cause around the lotus garden they have Candlle light.and there are some restourant and cafe there.nice.
A nice walk around.......very quiet and peaceful.. A nice temple to visit and photograph...quiet, not crowded and lovely. Not the biggest or unique...but nice. Enjoy.
very interesting. the beautiful architecture and adornment on the temple buildings is amazing. The guides are helpful and informative. Truly an awesome experience.
Beautiful temple. I and my family visited this temple when we stayed in Ubud. Beautiful temple with amazing pool, i am very interested about the culture and design very unique.
Excellent Look. It was a pleasant drive to the temple. WHen you go to Ubud, you can go to a series of tourist places including this temple. Calm location and can spend 1-2hours.

Peaceful and calm. Just a short walk from Ubud town to find this peaceful and calm place...
The water lily ponds were beautiful...a very nice and quiet place to stroll around.
Stop by the Indonesian-chic Starbucks by the entrance for a different Starbucks expericen from anywhere else in the world!

leaving calm and fresh and happy. this place was very peaceful and very beautiful there was a certain amount of calm that came over u as we entered.. we were lucky to be there for Nyepi celebrations and to witness all the offerings and it was a really beautiful experience.

Ignore Starbucks. Although Starbucks has opened next door, this does not detract from the serenity of the temple. The Lotus Cafe is a better place to have a tea and take in the surroundings of this Temple and grounds.
Work of Art. Temples are amazing to go to and this one is no different. Very beautiful...make sure you bring a sarong!

Nice view, but very small. A nice and quiet place, very close to Ubud's main street, but also very small... You will take 5 minutes to see everything... Also, there is a stage and a Starbucks right in front of the temple, which makes it very awkward...

Beautiful place for photos. I thought this was a beautiful place to take photos. It's right in the centre of Ubud and easily accessible. It's even better when the lotus flowers are blooming. There is also a cafe on the grounds of the temple where you can sit and take in the beauty of the place while sipping a cold drink.
Holiday Trip. Nice temple, this place consisted of many cultural things which made me feel amazing and interesting very much.
Very nice view. We really enjoyed lunch with temple view in Lotus restaurant. After eating we took great pictures in the temple. It's worth to visit it.

I thought this was the Starbucks Temple. There wasn't any information about this place. So I named it the "Starbucks Temple" as it's at Starbucks.
It really was lovely. But, not unlike any of the other temples in Bali.

Great Place for Photos.. We visited this wonderful little Balinese Temple only after the discovery that there is a hidden Starbucks just in front of it. I know, Starbucks, uggg. However, if you need to cool off for a few minutes, just walk into the stiffest AC in Ubud. It was nice. Anyway - The "Water Temple" sits just behind the Starbucks, and is a complex array of carved stones, archways, golden Balinese doors, Bonsai trees, and stairways. You can go inside if you are dressed appropriately, and we did go in for a quick walk around. The best part is the outside, with the flanking lotus ponds. We came back for evening photographs, waited out a quick shower, shot the pictures, and then went into the restaurant (Lotus Cafe) that sits almost on the grounds of the temple. Actually, if you go to eat here in the evening, on Saturday (I think) you will get a great view of the live dance performance at the base of the main stairway.

Incredible Setting. It was situated between the Lotus Café and Starbucks in Ubud city center. The temple is a gem in this cultural center of Bali-- easily accessible with an intimate setting and within walking distance to Ubud market.
Nice from outside. Lovely tradidtional Baliese Temple. Nest to Starbucksnear the Ubud Art market. Great pictures from the outside but it was closed so we were not able to go inside to explore.
Beautiful Temple !!. Beautiful temple amidst lotus ponds set in the heart of Ubud. Close to starbucks. IT has its own dance show in the evening. Great to take a few clicks !

Very picturesque. This temple was set along side the road with water fountains and pools everywhere. Loved to see the natural backdrop and different areas of the temple from a "birds-eye" view. Make sure to see this on your trip.
Peaceful place with Starbucks. Yep, there is a Starbucks cafè on the temple's territory. But it does not bother the place, which is worth to visit. Great photos guaranteed.

One of those moments that took my breath away!. You never know what to expect whenever of the actual location no matter how much research or reviews you can read. Sarawasti Temple was one of a few temples in Bali that completely took my breath away the moment we walked into view of the pond. Everything about it is just mythical and riched with details and history. This temple is one of a few that if you are dressed properly are allowed into the temple grounds. If you enjoy history, cultures, mythical imagery, rich details this temple ground absolutely will have you snapping away every steps you made.

Worth a (quick) look. Our tour guide brought us here almost by accident, as one in our party commented she wanted to get coffee in town. As we were from the U.S., the tour guide assumed we wanted Starbucks and it just so happens that there is a Starbucks right next to the entrance to this temple in Ubud. There are beautiful flowers and lily pads in front of the temple which make for great pictures. In all, we probably spent 15 minutes here since we couldn't go inside the temple. Definitely worth seeing while you are in Ubud, but we enjoyed the Tanah Lot temple more than Saraswati.

Beautiful outdoor stage!. We watched the barong dance here and Really enjoyed the performance but also the atmosphere of the compound! Would love to see another show here! Los, great cafe to eat dinner and relax at.

Nice location for a quick look. We´ve seen this temple by "accident", as we wanted to go to starbucks. It´s a nice, quite place which is beautiful. But i think you don´t need much time, we were there for 10 mins and it was absolutely enough. The sea roses infront of the temple are cool and kinda "romantic". So this place is perfect for a quick stay.

Beautiful but not for the dance show. The temple is definitely worth popping by. The ponds in front full of lily pads are very beautiful and great for photos. I bought a ticket for the all female orchestra and dance. At night the temple looks even more beautiful, but sadly it started raining, so we were moved inside to a bit of a grotty room. The performance was still very good - but lacked the atmosphere that would have been outside! On my walk back home after performance I could hear the one opposite the ubud palace and that sounded amazing! With singing too. So would recommend trying that one

Interesting, not the best in Bali. Amazing, unique, picturesque temple, but not the most impressive in Bali. Personally, I enjoyed more the pond with the flowers than the temple itself.There are a dozen more unique temples. I prefer the Royal temple and Tanah Lot.On the entrance to the Saraswati Temple there is a Starbucks and another cafe, pretty interesting, unexpected combination. Connection of East and West.
a nice little place. I enjoyed my visit to the Saraswati Temple.The temple was well maintained and clean.It's a jewel in the middle of Ubud.

Magnificent, just like Goddess Saraswati.. I was astonished with the magnificent lotus-pond that is in the forecourt of the temple, and the temple itself, probably hundreds of years old. Did not get the chance to go in but then, the view itself was mesmerizing. Located behind Starbucks Ubud, on the main road. Eye soothing while enjoying a cuppa!
Beautiful temple. one temple in Ubud, Very beautiful temple with Balinese architecture. This temple is located in the middle of the town of Ubud.
Nice!. Not as awesome as expected. The lotus were not looking very healthy everywhere, for best views sit out at Lotus Cafe
Visitors not invited. Visitors are not allowed to go inside the temple. The only good thing was the lotus pond in the temple campus. Beautiful campus.

Temple visit. This is amazing place to visit, very spiritual and peaceful. My husband and I loved visiting this temple and enjoying the surroundings. There is a Starbucks coffee shop near by if you need to stop and have a drink.

Culture, history and scenic!. Large beautiful Balinese Temple full of history. This is one of the few Temples in Bali fully open to the public. Best to go with a local guide to explain the many shrines. Worth the time to gain a full understanding and appreciation for the culture rather than simply snap a few pics. After enjoy a short walk up the side street for shopping and lunch. Bali culture is very rich and detailed, we enjoyed every moment and hope to return soon!
A unique condition. The Temple was in excellent condition. The cleanliness of the gardens and the buildings was also very noticeable.Staff were also very accommodating.

Must see! Beautiful architectre too... The temple at first sight, the gate, is very colourful and intricate. We looked for an entrance to it, but did not find it. So we asked a passing priest how to go in. After a lot of translation, he told us to turn left into the next door hotel entrance into the Saraswati temple. If you do not visit the inside you know will miss most of the temple. The inside we saw a lot of beautiful statues etc. The architecture is fantastic. It will take about 15 minutes to see. It is worth the time.
Beautifull and Gr8 Architecture. Lotus pond is nice, clean and great architecture, night time lighting awesome especially for the bali dance performances.
Peace n nice. I like everything n it is nice..it is also clean from every aspect...plus da toilets is available n easy way

Scenic and Relaxing. I was the only one here and there was a pile of sarongs to wrap around your waist to walk around. No activity which made it a little uneventful but the scenery is very peaceful and pretty. I read some people making a trip from Kuta or South Bali to go here - I wouldn't recommend going that far to see it.
Underwhelming. It was a very underwhelming experience for us. If you are staying in ubud, sure.If you are staying in nusa dua like we were, it's not worth the 1.5 hours to get there.

amazing culture show. must visit for culture dance show which starts at 8pm of one hour duration.beauty of show is only female artist perform,soothing music n mesmerizing dance.beautiful entry of temple with lotus ponds on both side.soothing lights at night.overall worth a visit.

Lovely Scenic Temple. I had this place bookmarked as a location to see in Ubud. Although we did not go inside the temple as we were told it is usually open for ceremonies only, it was a site to behold with the lotus pond, in the foreground of the wonderful Balinese architecture typical of the ancient temples in the Ubud area. The temple itself is next to Cafe Lotus which we got to admire the temple from and take some awesome photos. Definitely worth the humidity if you are inspired by the Balinese architecture and symbolism. In addition we were attracted to fact that this was a Saraswati temple, Goddess symbolising Knowledge, Arts and Culture who is often depicted in Hindu culture seated on a Lotus flower. Going inside would have added to the occasion but we respected that it was closed that day, unfortunately. So you may want to find out before hand if it is open. Plenty of cafes/restaraunts to keep you hydrated for walking around not forgetting the shade of massive tree that overlooks the ponds.

Beautiful Temple. The Saraswati Temple was very beautiful and welcoming. They provide Sarongs on site for visitors and we were lucky enough to observe a special day in their calendar. The water features and scenery are beautiful and it really is a natural masterpiece.

Beautiful!. Gorgeous from the outside and inside. Just don't forget to bring your sarong, scarf, and shoulder coverings! I see that a few reviewers are upset about the Starbucks outside, but honestly, it's pretty tastefully done to match the local architecture -- and its a good spot for a bathroom break!
Stop over. The Water Temple is worth a stop over, there is also a Starbucks Coffee at the gate if you want to rest your feet after the rice paddies walk.
Pictures can't capture how beautiful. Tucked away behind cafes (which was the perfect place to have my morning coffee) in the heart of Ubud but still beautiful and tranquil!
Beautiful temple in Ubud. It is a must-see if you are in Ubud. Beautiful and peaceful. There are lotus ponds just outside of this temple.

Starbucks by the temple???. Was very disappointed when visiting this temple to find a Starbucks right at the temple entrance! Obviously this leads to people leaving rubbish and spoils the serene atmosphere!We were unable to go inside as it was closed, but did manage to take a few photos of the outside.If imagine when the lilies are in full bloom it would be quite pretty!Worth a visit, at night you can see performances at the temple from the lotus cafe.

One of my favorite temples in Bali. I really like the set up of the temple with the pond all around. If you are hungry or needing some coffee, there is a restaurant and a coffee shop with tables facing the temple.

a must see when in Ubud. truly a beautiful experience.. the lush greens, the tranquil water and the natives paying tribute to their deities all make a wonderful and very "ubud" experience.. spending 1 1/2 hours wasnt enough. . . shopping for silk and ethnic table runners in the nearby stalls was great too.
Tiny oasis. Yes, it is small. Yes, it is gorgeous, full of bright flowers and ornate details. Feels like a tiny oasis among the bustling city.

Moonlight reflecting in the lotus pool. Be sure to check out this beautiful temple at night as well as during the day. Spectacular view. Too bad the dancing had been cancelled due to a ceremony the night we were there.

Traditional Dance in a heavenly place. We were lucky enough to see some of Bali's best dancers in the beautiful location of this temple. We enjoyed dinner beforehand and then sat and watched the dancing. The costumes, makeup and those gorgeous smiles were amazing. Great value as always in Ubud.
fascinating!!. fascinating place, its present energy, very beautiful, nightly dinners with national dances.be sure to visit everyone!!!

Beautiful Temple right in Ubud. This is a really pretty place. There weren't too many folks there when we strolled it. Great place, water, sculpture, Bali. Good for foto ops. It's right in Ubud, so you don't have to go far to see it when you're there. Worth it!

loved this place- truly beautiful. fantastic hidden temple amongst the hustle and bustle of Bali life.
take the time to stroll around and take in the peace of this temple. Pack a sarong on your trip, every temple requires a sarong to be worn .
Tranquil in the midst of hustle and bustle. wonderful temple. free to visit. take the time to look in. Tranquillity amongst the hustle and bustle of Bali.

A nice place you must say. No long time to visit, but nice area with Lotus. Ubud centertown, near the market center, you must go and see this place. A small one, with a nice coffee nearside. Old (closed) temple, and nice nature arround. Many lotus and quiet . ( except at nigth where sometimes you can have LEDONG dances with many people, but it's also interest to Watch ).

Very poetic. A small but SO charming temple in Ubud! With its waters and nenuphars, it is one of my favorites!
The adjacent Lotus Café is a very nice place for a quiet afternoon drink!

Our trip. Great place to go.
You will see all religious people celebrating.
we went on Full Moon day, Poornima.
There were people even lined up for ritual bath.
But there were no noises, all was quite, disciplined and very smooth.
Something every one must learn.
Must visit

Just Lovely!. We were invited to attend traditional dancing here by our Villa owners, we were so taken by the venue we came back for another look in daylight. We were not dissapointed the place is gorgeous, night and day! But the dancing could not have been set at a better venue- it all just added to the experience. Cafe Lotus overlooking the Temple is also worth a visit for a bit of down time looking at the view.

Beautiful setting with lotus flowers. The temple is surrounded by lotus flowers in the ponds in front of the temple. The view is beautiful and worth a visit. There are restaurants nearby overlooking the temple, but I ate elsewhere. There are also traditional dancers there of an evening.
Beautiful place to stop for lunch or a coffee. Serene and peaceful, sitting next to the lotus pond at Cafe Lotus. Had a great Indonesian meal with drinks for $25AUS
Beautiful. At main street. Nice pool with lotos plants. Good place to take some photos. Also cafe. Open till night.

amazing Balinese dance performance. when i reached temple at 7:30 pm there was balinese dance performance by balinese females for idr 80,000.it was amazing ,worth to spend .i saw few dance performances like barong dance,fire dance etc.but this was the best.nice lotus ponds,nice ambiance.must visit

Completely Beautiful. Just a couple of steps off the street (behind Starbucks) you enter a haven of serenity and beauty. The lotus flower is quite amazing and the pond is beautiful. One of the best kept temples we saw and all completely free, not to be missed!!

Nice lotus pond. This is a very small temple but the lotus pond is very nice to see.
The reflecting temple in the pond is enjoyable by day.

Lotus ponds. We were taken here by friends. I arrived and it was nice touches and great views of the lotus ponds. The cafe was looking nice.but didnt have lunch here.if I had more time.i would of attended.
A nice temple in the centre of Ubud. This is a beautiful temple, but it deserves more space. It feels like an add-on to the Starbucks at its entrance. Go early to avoid the crowds.

Go early to have the Temple to yourselves!!. We visited this Temple and its lovely Lotus Pool on our first day in Ubud, and it was truly peaceful. I suspect it is not quite so peaceful later in the day, but it is well worth the visit!! Given it's right in the centre of town and will only take a little while to look around, you've nothing to lose!!

Lovely temple, in the middle of town. We spend an hour exploring the wonderful Lotus pond and the outside of the temple complex. Very pretty, lovely details everywhere, a little oasis in the middle of very busy Ubud. There is no entrance fee. The Starbucks café didn't bother us, its an old building that fits in with it's surroundings and we actually grabbed our self a nice iced coffee after our visit.

A little disappointing. I visited this temple during the day, it's right next door to Starbucks which took away some of the atmospherics for me. It's small and easy to walk around, it took about 30 minutes of my time but there are many statues to see. I imagine it's a more impressive experience at night when the traditional dancing takes place - this I got a glimpse of from the busy main street.
Average. Its a temple with lake view. Go there in the evening for dance performance or check out the cafe. Can spent 30 minutes

Entrance at between Starbucks coffee and Cafe Lotus . Not so easy to find if you don't have this information, even some of the local drivers don't know about this place. Were not able to enter the temple but the carving outside is already very magnificent. Signboard stated about wearing sash or sarong when enter the temple, and female during menstrual period is prohibited to witness the ritual.

Convenient temple . The Saraswati temple was the first temple my wife and I visited in Bali. Our hotel had a shuttle that dropped us off on a block away from it. The temple is unique and beautiful although the Starbucks right at its main entrance takes away from its character. To our surprise there was only a few people looking at the temple which is nice when you are taking photos. You are required to cover up if you are wearing shorts or revealing shirts, but there are sarongs provided at the temple.

Neat Little Place. One of the first temples we saw in Ubud. Easy, as it's pretty much right there off the main strip. The place is pretty small as attractions go, but still neat to see all the stonework and the flowers. Lots of fish in the water. Some semblance of tranquility, even though the busy street is just out front.If you get thirsty or hungry, there's a restaurant and a Starbucks right at the entrance.
Easy to access, quick to visit. Like: the carivings along the stage and the font. Location in the town centre so little effort to see itDislike: wish it was larger!

Lovely Lotus Pond. Although it's small, it's still worth a visit. Tucked behind Lotus Cafe and Starbucks, the temple is like a little getaway from the busy Jl Raya Ubud. It has a very nice lotus pond. You can't enter the temple, just admire the architecture from the compound. There is traditional dance every Thursday evening where you can enjoy from Lotus Cafe.

Grab a coffee and enjoy the view. Its definitely a nice temple and if you are in UBUD then you should come and visit. Its very small and you cannot actually go inside but its just enough to see the pond, the stage and the main doors.This temple is located close to the end of the famous Monkey forest road,with the palace close by and the market. You cannot miss the entrance as there is a big Starbucks and an Indonesian restaurant. We did not even know about the temple but the Balinese music got me going and looking for its source.

Starbucks ruins the atmosphere. It is hard to enjoy a temple visit when, just after the entry (free, even if you will find people at the gate trying to sell you tickets for the nightly dance show) there is an ugly Starbucks. I mean, it is right inside the temple, beside the lotus pools... To reach the water temple you have to walk between that one and another coffee-restaurant, Lotus bar, that practically blot out the view of the temple from the main street. This bar's outside tables are inside the temple as well. It's a shame, I mean, it's supposed to be an holy place...

Nice but small. Overall, it was quite aesthetically pleasing; however the temple's main doors were closed so visitors are only allowed to view a small portion of the temple. The small lake was quite scenic and the temple was a nice backdrop. Would recommend for a small break in the centre of busy Ubud, however not really worth a visit otherwise. Entrance is also free.

Must see in ubud. Saraswati temple is in the high street of Ubud and we just wandered in whilst shopping. The temple was closed at the time - opening hours were 8 - 4/5 pm. so went back the next day, could go inside the temple - no hassle, no guides, making it quiet and serene.
beautiful. You can give the lotus cafe a miss, but don't miss the Lotus Garden next to it. It is worth the visit.

Peaceful setting & interesting temple. Had lunch at the lotus cafe, sat on the bamboo floor which was lovely, right next to the lotus pond. Beautiful setting as the lotus ponds lead up the the temple entrance! Doesn't cost anything to visit the temple but don't expect to get in unless u are wearing full Balinese dress, you can borrow a sarong & scarf at the entrance - there is a donation box as you walk in. Defiantly worth a visit if u are in ubud area! Nice to step inside a temple and get a look into Balinese religion. Great setting for photos

Cool temple with a view!. This temple is really pretty with the lily pad lake in front. Definitely a spot for a photos. We went later in the afternoon and there was hardly anyone there which was better for photos. Not huge, so doesn't need a lot of time!
Beautiful view.. Stuck in the Ubud downtown area it really worth the visit. Beautifull view and no entrance fee. I recommend!

Very beautiful, good place for photos. You don't need much time, it's right in the centre of Ubud and it's one of the most beutiful temples in Ubud. At night they have a performance that is quite interesting if you haven't seen any yet.

Must-See in Ubud. The Pura Saraswati is located in the centre of Ubud at the main road. For me it was one of the prettiest temples in Bali (and I saw a lot ;) ). It's not that big but a beautyful picture with the lake in front of it. If you want to go in don't forget your sarong, you cannot rent it there. In the evenings you can see the legong dance here.A unique thing would be the Starbucks gong at the entrance ;)

Very pretty temple - only 20 minutes needed. Very pretty temple in downtown Ubud. Best to combine with breakfast or lunch. Great for photography and portrait photos but I am not sure you can enter the temple complex.

Very pretty, tie it in with your lunch plans. This was a very pretty temple, but like most temples, don't expect to enter unless you are in full balinese dress. This really means that you can't spend more than 15 minutes appreciating the exterior of the building. We happened to visit the cafe next to the temple to make this visit more substantial and this was a good move, very nice food and gave us the chance to fully enjoy this peaceful setting.

Pretty. This particular temple is pretty and the grounds are nice. If you are near it, it is probably worth looking at, but I would not go out of my way to see it. Others may have a different view.Also, if you are looking for it, it is just behind Starbucks.

Quiet setting. The main temple was closed when we went. (Friday) I was told some dance programs happen early mornings or in the evening. The place had a huge lotus pond and the whole setting is idyllic. There is a Starbucks next to this and it's at out of a beautiful building too. There is also a cafe in this space. Its beautiful to just sit there while you sip your drink.
Very serene temple. This was an amazing temple. When we went there, folks were doing some artwork within premises, so it was even more nice. We enjoyed the beautiful idol of the Goddess Saraswathi.

Beautiful temple. The temple surrounded by lilies is beautiful. This is in the centre of town & is well worth the visit. We did not get to go inside as there was a royal wedding on during the week we were in Ubud but we do not feel like we missed out as the outside was stunning.
Grand Temple.. Amazing architecture and glimpse on the culture of Indonesian people. The grandness of the architecture, craftsmanship.
Nice.... Not a day trip, not a destination trip either, but another temple with interesting sites which makes for some nice photos

Great food and ambiance.. Very nice location for a temple, smack dab in the middle of town. Couldn't ask for anything better...... except being right next to a Starbucks! It look a little of the mystic away.

A Calm and Quiet place, highly recommend.. Small and beautiful, can be missed easily given that it's commercialised and hidden by a restaurant in the front (seen this quiet a lot across temples in Bali, not sure why). Seems favourite with local kids, they fish in the ponds and the water garden. I found this place a must see, the statute of Goddess Saraswati, who bestows education and intelligence, beautifully portrayed, tucked in a corner, cannot miss this in white and gold. The orchids and adenium bonsai are a plus and beautify the place. An hour or less is enough to go around. The traffic of Ubud will take a lot of time for you to reach the place. At the entrance, people sell tickets, but that's not for entering the temple but for the dance performance in the evenings. So, watch out.The sad part is the temple is abused, cigarette butts and empty beer bottles thrown around. This is not good, request tourists to maintain the decorum of the temple and disturb sentiments of the believers, I felt bad and disturbed.
Beautiful. This place is just serene. Go at dusk to appreciate it by day and night. The show can be watched also from the Lotus Cafe.

hidden treasure. during a hot afternoon looking for refreshment we stumbled on upon this temple actually. we went to a cafe/restaurant and to our suprise we saw this beuatiful temple on the grounds next to the bar. we couldn't see this from te streetA\s we came in we discovered it and we sat down at the low tables on the deck over the pond in front of the temple to have a drink and a bite wich were both very tasty by the way , we took a look around the temple grounds of coz and it was very nice and typical balinees so as we travelled on we told eachother that it has been a nice surprise for us and we recommend this place to everyone .

Beautiful & peaceful. This was our first stop in Ubud .. Very peaceful & serene .. You can visit it when you're done with a long busy day shopping in Ubud, & chill in the Lotus cafe inside, contemplate the scenery .. It's definitely worth the visit ..

Beautiful temple, interesting dance (thurs). The Pura Saraswati Temple was definitely worth visiting during the day for some unique and beautiful architecture and scenery. We arrived early evening to catch the dance (every thurs 730) We were told the wrong time and ended up waiting over an hour for the dance to start. I think it was worth the wait, and enjoyed the costumes and skill of the dancers. My husband is harder to please and finally talked me in to leaving before the end of the show. The temple is definately worth a visit and easy to see if you are wandering through Ubud. Only see the dance if you like that sort of thing! I thought it was great!

Beautiful Temple. Being from India, i can say that I have seen my fair share of temples :) But this temples stands out especially for the Lotus Pond surrounding it. The blooming lotuses, the rock architecture make the place very serene and peaceful.Sadly cudn't enter the temple :(

well worth the visit. Beautiful peaceful place right in thr hustle and bustle of Ubud, you can sit in quite a fancy restaurant overlooking it if you want but quite pricey. Well worth having a cold drink and a bit of respite though.
Beautiful Temple. This is a beautiful, very peaceful place. This is definitely worth a visit. It was very nice to get out of the hubbub of the Ubud streets and find the oasis!

Peaceful and serene. A lovely visit to this temple and neighboring Lotus cafe. This is a beautiful temple definitely worth seeing. The Lotus cafe next door overlooks the Lilly ponds and temple so stop here for a quiet drink on your travels around Ubud and you won't be disappointed.
Purity. As I was travelling to Bali for Detox and Purification, I loved the feeling of getting myself purified in what Hinduist consider as THE purifying source for the body and soul ;)

A very picturesque temple. Although the main temple is closed to the public (like many are) this temple is still very beautiful as on either side of the pathways leading up to it there is water with many lily pads on it. It is amazing that you can find such peace and tranquility when just outside there is absolute chaos.

A pond full of lotus and a starbucks. Nothing much to see here, the main temple is close like the rest of the temples in ubud. There is a starbucks for those who wants to just sit around. The pond do contain lotus but that is about all. Entry is free though.

Beautiful Lotus Flowers in front of Temple. After enjoying morning coffee in Starbucks Ubud, amazed by beautiful lotus flowers in front of temple. It's located in front of Starbucks. I suggest this place because it is a very good spot to take photographs or even painting in canvas. The ambience give you peaceful aura and stunning landscape.

Beatiful temple. This is a beatiful temple in the heart of Ubud. The access is free and there 's a restaurant overlooking the temple and the lotus pond. It is well maintained, not crowded and recommnded to take photos of typical Balinese scene. Parking however is bit difficult as it's only 1 lane with cars parking along the street.

Stunning temple. Wow is the one word that comes to mind. The most idyllic set temple i saw! Surrounded by lotus ponds it is breath-taking. Not much to do there but we booked a table at the restaurant (Lotus I think it's called) and watch one of the shows in the evening from the "deck" area - was excellent!
Impressive!. A beautiful temple, very photogenic too. The frangipani trees must be so old ... the Lotus Cafe is a good spot to have a cold drink and admire the view of the temple.

Lovely Temple to Look at While You Drink Your Coffee. This is a gorgeous royal temple fronted by a very large lotus pond. You can't actually go inside the temple, but you can contemplate it and its pond while dining at the Lotus Cafe or Starbucks which front it. Very sumptuous. Makes great photos.

Worth paying a visit. The temple is located behind the Starbucks caffee at the Raya Ubud. It is on the same road as the Ubud palace. In December there were no lotus flowers, but I can imagine the temple looking wonderful if the waters are covered in flowers. Walking up to the temple is free, so no need to skip it when in Ubud. When back in the road walk a bit further until you see the sign 'Ubud rice fields'. I went there jogging 2 mornings and it was wonderful. The track goes all the way round through the rice fields and gives you a feeling of the real Bali!

Very beautiful. This is located next to the lotus cafe. It's great to have lunch overlooking the beauty of the place. it's very central and good for a quick visit. Touristy of course, but if you are staying in Ubud (highly recommended) come here early in the morning before all the buses arrive.
Beautiful Temple behind Starbucks. This is a really nice temple just behind Starbucks in Ubud. Really quiet when we visited and one of the nicest temples I saw while in Bali.
Quick must see. I passed by this place early in the mourning (6 o clock), so that there was nobody else nearby and the place looked stunning with a rising sun.
Great start to the Ubud Experience. I read the tripadvisor reviews or never would have noticed this beautiful temple behind Starbucks. Very quiet with few visitors. Really nice!
Hidden gem. A lovely example of a traditional Balinese temple conveniently located in the centre of town (behind Starbucks!)

Nice clean place very close to Ubud Market. This looks like an old bungalow converted in to stay. Lovely sculptures. Small clean rooms. Before you check in ensure they air your room. The breakfast is nothing great but filling. compared to couple of other places we saw around the same area this was pretty decent

Worth a visit. The Pura Saraswati Temple and Lotus Pond were beautiful and I'm definitely glad my husband and I went in. To enter the temple, we had to wear a sarong, and for a donation at the entrance we were provided the appropriate attire. The structures, statues and carvings of the temple were stunning. Visiting this site did not take long - but was well worth it since we were in Ubud.
Beautiful temple. Must visit if you are in Ubud. Not many tourists and you can sip coffee from Cafe Lotus (just across the temple) and enjoy the beauty of this temple.

Starbucks?. Of all places to find a tacky coffee shop in such a beautiful location. We found this place by accident while just cruising around Ubud. Well maintained and tidy and a pleasure for the camera lovers. A lot of people were in attendance on the day of our visit and I know why. Such a serene place and well worth the search. It would have been a great spot for a coffee but I don't like Starbucks. Plenty of seats about so a good place for a break and drink. The water gardens were pleasure to the eye. I would recommend this place to others if staying in central Ubud

The hidden temple of Ubud. Pura Saraswati Temple is easily reachable in downtown Ubud and unfortunately not much visited by tourists. The reason: It is almost hidden behind Starbuck and Lotus Café's premises. But, being just a little bit curious, you'll get a chance to visit this magnificent temple surrounded by the most beautiful lotus flower ponds and ancient stone carved walls. Walk around, smell the flowers and let your mind fly away. You are in Bali, it is magic. Enjoy!

Classic Balinese Temple on Lotus Pond. Pura Saraswati is an absolutely gorgeous Balinese temple located on a beautiful lotus pond. It was challenging to find among the bustling streets of Ubud, especially because it's tucked behind a Starbucks and Cafe Lotus, and not immediately visible! But once we found it, we were SO happy we did. We explored the temple, and then had a light dinner at the Cafe Lotus, which is perfectly good and provides a relaxing place to sit and enjoy the view of the temple as the sun sets. We would have stayed for the evening performance, but time was not on our side that day. Highly recommend!

Ubud's most beautiful temple complex + best venue for cultural performances. Other than being marred by a Starbucks (of all things) at the entrance, this is the most beautiful temple complex in Ubud and by far the best venue to appreciate a cultural performance (sometimes they practice by the pond in the afternoon) as the backdrop is lit up at night. You can also go to the Starbucks (ugh!) and sit on the back veranda or go to the restaurant complex on the other side to watch a performance albeit both places are way overpriced for food/drink (ESPECIALLY the Starbucks!!!). If the lilies were in the pond were in bloom, the setting would be even more spectacular.

Beautiful Temple Complex. The Pura Taman Kemude Saraswati is a Balinese Hindu Temple, devoted to the Goddess of Wisdom, Science and Art. Situated in the city center of Ubud, with two nice lotus ponds. Worthwhile a visit!

Beautiful! Also attend a performance there. Its not a big place, but has a beautiful lotus pond in front. Its between Starbucks and Cafe Lotus. I walked by the entrance half a dozen times, without ever noticing there was a temple here. It wasn't until I literally saw a sign announcing a performance that I realized it was the water temple. Definitely try to see a performance here, as it is an excellent venue. I watched The Ramayan Ballet, which was fantastic.

Wooow Amazing. we greatly admire the Balinese carvings, this temple is one of the temples we visited in Bali. Very complete carvings that have significance in Balinese culture in the capture of the Hindu story.

Great place and perfect venue to see traditional dance. Very nice temple in the centre of Ubud. Surrounded by lily ponds which look great, especially in the evening when the temple is lit up. Viewable from the nearby Cafe Lotus (which we didn't try) and the Starbucks near the entrance.We decided to watch the Balinese dancing here, although there is a lot of choice in Ubud. Glad we did as it was very atmospheric setting and a great experience, with a relatively small audience. One of the highlights of our holidays in fact. It seems they have different dance companies on during the week and I think we were lucky that ours was very good indeed (was a Weds).Would recommend it if you are lucky enough to be in Ubud!

Amazing temple in the heart of Ubud. Beautiful scenery right in the middle of a busy town. Amazing pond filled with lotus and water lily, perfect for a picture backdrop or a screen saver. Can also sit and enjoy coffee at Starbucks while at the same time, nonetheless it's mostly crowded with people unless u be there early to grab a spot. It looks even better at night when the spot lights are up. I'm coming back again next year.

Gorgeous temple. I was wandering through Ubud and stumbled upon this amazing temple. The entrance grounds are quite the spectacle. Dozens of lily pads cover the pond with several in bloom - if you're lucky. I didn't go into the temple grounds but I very much enjoyed admiring the stonework and plants in and around the area. Definitely check this temple out if you're in the area, it's worth at least some time to explore.

Almost perfect if not for the Starbucks in front. It was really a surprise to find this right smack in the middle of central Ubud. You would not know there was a temple inside since the entrance there is a starbucks coffee. Walked in by accident and was amazed how beautiful it is. Not a bad spot to just sit and relax after shopping at Ubud market. They also have cultural shows here.
Beautiful. a very beautiful temple, one of the temple in Ubud is only 5 minutes from Ubud market. If you been to Ubud do not forget to pay a visit to this temple.

Beautifully enchanting. This temple is simply a great, take simply an hour out of the day and take a peek. Beautiful lily pads in the water surrounded by beautiful stone work.Also situated in the centre of ubud so so accessible

Beautiful!!. Great temple right in the center of Ubud! Just enter next to the Starbuck's (-this must be the weirdest spot for a Starbuck's EVER!-) and enjoy the scenery. Great spot to take some romantic photos.

small, peaceful retreat. The approach to this temple through the lotus ponds is very beautiful and a perfect photo opportunity, but the inside although small is well worth venturing into. I have read a few reviews that says it is not always open, however we walked right in (mid morning) and had the place to ourselves. It was very clean and quiet with some interesting statues, and for the traveller with limited time is perfectly located in the centre of Ubud. The exterior is transformed at night with lighting for the dance show and is also worth seeing then even if you don't watch the show.

Excellent Temple, Not Touristy!. Pura Saraswati is one of the best temples in Bali. The temple features a full sized idol of Goddess Saraswati. Its a blessing in disguise that it does not figure amongst the frequented tourist attractions. There is no one hussling you to buy souveniers, no one heckling you to take guides. There's a pile of neatly folded sarongs kept at the entrance. To visit the temple, you have to pick up a sarong and wrap it on. No fee charged for the sarong, however, there's a donation box placed next to the sarongs and visitors may drop in a donation at their will.

This is OUTSTANDING !!! at the Lotus Resturant the view is great.. The Puri Saraswati temple is on the main road Jalan Raya about 2 blocks from the Ubud Market. ( which was redone last year ) It is easy walking. 2 gigantic lotus pools...beautiful carvings. The whole experience takes about 15 minutes once you arrive. Not to be missed.

Wooow, Beautiful Temple. If you are into Ubud town do not forget to visit the saraswati temple. Really beautiful and interesting. Our whole family after the way in the market about 1 hour we spent time visiting here.

My favorite temple in Ubud. Maybe because of the pond or the lotus or the layout of the place... but I went many times when I was there. Although it is a bit expensive you can enjoy a drink and the view at the café located on your left as ou come in from the street.The Pura Saraswati is a freat place for pictures, to meditate or just for a rest.

Nice temple for photoshoot. This is a very nice temple behind Lotus Cafe and Starbucks. When I visited the temple was closed, so I took pictures from outside. The pond in front of the temple is full of lotus plants. If you are wandering around the market area in Ubud, you can spend 10 minutes taking lovely pictures of the temple and the pond

Artfully designed, nature inspired.. Artfully designed and nature inspired is a short description to define the beauty of this temple gate, park, ponds, and trees.Pohon kamboja (Frangipani), Teratai (Nymphaea) and other plants can create good serene view.The temple gate is splendid with its motif decoration and typical Balinese color.

Gorgeous. Absolutely beautiful temple and pond. A bit odd that it is right next to starbucks, but that is actually okay. After a long day of walking around in the heat and humidity of Ubud, you can sit down at starbucks, order a cold drink and marvel at this beautiful work of architecture.

Beautiful temple just behind cafe in the heart of Ubud. First time we went to this temple not because we knew there is a temple, but actually we went to the cafe for a lunch :) and when we went inside the cafe ... voila! There is a beautiful temple hidden just behind the cafe! Between cafe and the temple there are two ponds with lotuses inside it .... on the right and left side of the small pathway, the ponds are beautifully set and framed the temple ....Just the same name they gave for the cafe, "Cafe Lotus"!It's free to visit this temple, but you should wear a sarong.
Beautiful. One of the temples we visited in Ubud, located in the center of Ubud. Very beautiful temple, still keep and save today by Hindus in Ubud.
magical mornings. its beautiful nd early mornings nd evenings r magical ... u can go 2 lotus cafe fr breakfast nd sit at the table facing the temple , its just an unbelievable beginning o a day..
The lotus pond is very beautiful!. Just behind Starbucks and there is "Lotus cafe"very nice atmosphere.Take a few great picture of the great architecture with the lotus pond!

Well kept lotus ponds with a backdrop of Balinese temple architecture. Few steps onto the walkway with lotus ponds on your sides gives you uplifting sense of nature. The concrete facade of the temple welcomes you to the temple for a cultural spiritual charging.

Beautiful temple just of the main street. This is a stunning temple off the jostle of the main street in Ubud. The lotus pools are simply stunning and photo opportunities abound at every turn. Make sure that you have appropriate atire however. shorts and skimpy tops are a definite no-no! Cafe Lotus is on the corner but frankly I would not eat there as it seems rather third rate with tourist type menus in multiple languages. (also spotted a rat around the back). There are much better places to eat

Beautiful Pictures of serenity. This temple provides some tranquility in what otherwise would be a very busy, loud street. The views from the outside are stunning, but note that you will need proper attire within the temple itself. You won't need more than 20 minutes here, but do make sure you add it to your itinerary. Cafe Lotus sits on the corner of this temple property with views of the lotus ponds and temple. I would recommend a stop at the Cafe for a relaxing drink, or to get off your feet for a bit, but don't waste your money on the food.

Best stage I've even seen. That was the most impressive stage I've even seen. It's a great experience to go there during the day and back at night for the spectacle. Also enjoyed getting to know a bit more about their Hindu culture. Recommended.

Lovely. Very nice for a quick walk around. The pond is beautiful, the temple peaceful. Although you get a great view of the pond and temple from the Cafe Lotus, don't make the mistake of eating there: the food is third rate.

peaceful lotus pond. Walked around the lotus pond and then grabbed a Starbucks on our way out. The temple itself was very beautiful and peaceful when we were there.. Not a lot of people which was nice to enjoy.

Lotus pond, Temple, Starbucks. Nice temple with a beautiful garden lotus pond area. Spectacular in full bloom. I went to the temple, ate at the restaurant, had a starbucks and saw a fire dance there. The back alley behind the temple is fun to walk around at night and it's fun to play with the dogs and later watch them greet their owners when they come home from work.

Stunning at dusk. When everything is lit up and the fountains are going, just before sunset, this place is gorgeous. Worth a visit just to enjoy the ambiance and snap a few photos. Easily accessible just behind Cafe Lotus and Starbucks - no need to visit Cafe Lotus in order to see the temple.

ANCIENT AND REAL TEMPLE. This is a very unique and magnetic venue to visit. It gives thetraditional Balinese Hindu belief and knowledge to all visitorswho are interested in understanding where the heart of Balioriginates.

Beautiful lotus pond. I accidentally discovered this when I stopped by the Starbucks right next to it. The lotus pond and the path that leads up to the temple is beautiful, especially when it's lit at dusk. I didn't try the restaurant there but it definitely looked nice and relaxing. I think it's well worth a stop to spend about 10-20 minutes here to enjoy the tranquility and scenery.

Ubud - Hidden Paradise. If you came to ubud.. don't forget to spend your time about 20 minutes to visit this place, you can see the lotus pond and if you are lucky you can see this blossom Lotus Flower on the pond. you can visit the temple, taking picture.. How you reach here?? If you know the Starbucks outlet in Ubud, the entrance is between Starbucks and Lotus Cafe.
Peaceful hidden place. Beautiful temple with lotus/ watergarden- spacious green areaLarge cafe Lotus/ restaurant with good view, also gazebo for artclasses

Temple with a lotus pond. This temple also known as water palace,located beside cafe lotus,with a pond full of lotus,beautiful scene,traditional perfomance held at night here,each day with different programs,better check first,if it rains,the performance will be moved to an indoor venue.

Lotus pond and majestic temple!. I stumbled upon this pura waiting for my friend buying a drink in Starbucks (don't judge!). This is located just behind starbucks and what a find. Great view. We went there early in the morning so we had the view to ourselves. Nice and peaceful.
Great temple and lotus pond. A really nice temple and lotus pond. Just drink a cup of tea in the lotus cafe wit a view on the pura.

Tranquil. Well worth spending a couple minutes in this beautiful water garden while you're in Ubud. The setting at night takes on a magical feel thanks to attractive lighting. Whether you enjoy a meal in the overlooking cafe or just stop off for some quiet reflection on your way back to the hotel after a night out, you are sure to enjoy the pleasant surroundings. Don't forget your camera.

Very nice pond with waterlillies. This is definitely worth a look. The pond can be viewed easily. The temple however can only be entered if you wear a sarong that you have to bring yourself.FYI the restaurant Cafe Lotus has a nice view of this but for the rest is nothing to write home about

FABULOUS TEMPLE with wonderful Lotus Resturant next door. Just beautiful a backdrop for a fablulous movie ...it has 2 lotus ponds big as soccer fields !. Dancing exibitions , with beautiful seating at Lotus Resturant.Right on the main street about 2 locks from the UBUD general market...which is a hoot and a treat.
